name: Theme Park Studio
description: Theme Park Studio is a powerful suite of tools that allows players to design, build, and experience stunning amusement parks of their own design. Players can build whatever they can imagine, and then share it online for others to experience. Theme Park Studio includes Steam Workshop integration.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP or later Processor: 2.2 GHz dual core processor Memory: 2 GB RAM Graphics: Nvidia 8800 GPU DirectX: Version 9.0 Storage: 5 GB available space Sound Card: DirectX compatible
recommended_requirements: OS: Windows XP or later Processor: 2.2 GHz dual core processor Memory: 3 GB RAM Graphics: Nvidia 8800 GPU DirectX: Version 9.0 Storage: 5 GB available space Sound Card: DirectX compatible

reviews.review_text: i bought this awhile back over planet coaster it seemed more exciting and now its like eww yea you updating vr stuff alot of good that does me, weres the rides? train rides, water rides, air lifts, theme rides and decor and it so buggy it barely runs and today i see its been realesed ?  i still play it often and will continue but im kinda disapointed over all.

Do not waste your time/money. Dev support is a joke, I honestly thought they gave up on this game a long time ago only to have it come out of early access just to compete with Planet Coaster. It is very unfinished/unstable and I'm not even going to try the Vive VR mode for this very reason. It sucks that I've spent so much time giving this game a chance and I hope others are not duped into supporting this incomplete product.

By far the worst game ive ever tried. Crashes constantly (On a good computer too), lags really bad, very un-user friendly, really hard and slow to make something relatively nice, graphics are awful for a game of this day and the devs are horrible at offering support. this game is far to confusing!
